description.en: Adds support for Telldus Z-wave devices

instruction.en:
Automatically add device to network
When the device is inserted into an electrical outlet it’s in automatical add mode for four minutes (Network Wide Inclusion, NWI). This means that the device is added automatically when the Z-wave controller enters add mode.
Manually add device to network
Start the add mode on the Z-wave controller. Press the button on the device three times fast.The device will now be added into the Z-wave network
When the device is not added to any Z-wave network, the LED will flash red slowly.

hint.en: Z-Wave Plus Lifeline - Plug status - Max 1 node
The plug will send Basic Set control signals to the nodes in this group whenever the status of the plug changes. This will work like a master/slave solution. Maximum 10 nodes.

instruction.en: Select 'Remove a device' from Homey settings under 'Z-wave'. Press the button on the device three times fast. The device will now be removed from the Z­-wave network

label.en: Setting device status after power failure

hint.en:
1 ?(remember status).
Possible values: 0: Always off, 1: Remember status, 2: Always on.

0 = The function is disabled.
1 = Send Basic report. (default)
2 = Send Basic report only when Load status is not changed by Z-WAVE Command.

0 = The LED status follows the load change.
1 = When operating the load, the LED lights for 5 seconds and then turns off.
